quizlet:
verb, auxiliary verb, noun : *to be; being*

Être une personne gentille peut être un pouvoir.
To be a kind person can be a power.

verb, auxiliary verb : *to have*

Il a bon se sentir heureux.
He feels good to be happy.

personal pronoun : *I*

Je ne suis pas petit.
I am not small.

preposition : *of, from, by, than, in, with (see #28)*

J'ai un cadeau de toi.
I have a gift from you.

adverb : *not*

Je ne trouve pas mon livre.
I can't find my book.

adverb, noun : *not; step, pace*

Toi, tu ne passes pas par ici.
You, you don't pass by here.

definite article, personal pronoun : *the; him, it (refering to a masculine singular noun) (see #8, 15, 18)*

Le même chien joue avec l'autre.  
The same dog plays with the other.

definite article, personal pronoun : *the; her, it (refering to a feminine singular noun) (see #7, 15, 18)*

Je vais la donner ici.
I am going to give it here.

personal pronoun : *you*

Tu as tout d'accord.
You agree with everything.

personal pronoun : *you, yourself*

Vous êtes dans la salle pour la réunion.
You are in the room for the meeting.

personal pronoun : *he, it*

Il s'est arrivé à la maison.
He arrived at the house.

conjunction : *and*

Elle aime son chat et se promène dans le jardin.
She loves her cat and walks in the garden.

preposition : *in, to, with*

Je peux aller à la plage pour voir le coucher du soleil.
I can go to the beach to see the sunset.

indefinite article : *a, an; one (used before a masculine singular noun) (see #26, 31)*

Elle a un de mes livres.
She has one of my books.

definite article, personal pronoun : *the (used instead of ''le'' or ''la'' before nouns that begin with a vowel) (see #7, 8, 18)*

L'ami de vous est gentil.
Your friend is kind.

relative pronoun, interrogative pronoun : *who, whom; that, which*

Cette personne qui parle avec moi est gentille.
This person who is talking with me is kind.

verb : *to go*

Je vais parler à son ami.
I am going to talk to his friend.

definite article, personal pronoun : *the; them (referring to a plural noun) (see #7, 8, 15)*

Les devoirs sont dans le sac.
The homework is in the bag.

preposition, personal pronoun, adverb : *in, into, to, as*

Merci pour les fleurs, je m'en souviendrai quand tu reviendras.
Thank you for the flowers, I will remember it when you come back.

demonstrative pronoun : *this, that (see #203)*

Ça, c'est des choses à faire.
That, it's things to do.

verb : *to do, make*

Le petit garçon aime faire du bruit avec son tambour.  
The little boy likes to make noise with his drum.

adjective, indefinite adjective, indefinite pronoun, adverb, noun : *all, everything, any; very, quite*

Tout ça est plus facile.
All that is easier.

personal pronoun : *we, you*

On prend ce que tu veux.
We take what you want.

relative pronoun, interrogative pronoun : *that; what; which*

La question qu'elle se pose est si elle peut venir.
The question she asks herself is if she can come.

demonstrative pronoun, demonstrative adjective : *this, that (see #73, 99, 201)*

Ce livre est pour lui ou pour elle?
This book is for him or for her?

indefinite article : *a, an; one (used before a feminine singular noun); french.languagedaily.com (see #14, 31)*

Elle a une pomme, mais elle n'y touche pas.
She has an apple, but she doesn't touch it.

possessive adjective : *my (used before plural nouns) (see #50, 108)*

Mes amis ont le pouvoir de changer le monde.
My friends have the power to change the world.

preposition : *of, from, by, than, in, with (used before a vowel or mute h) (see #4)*

Je veux aller à la plage, mais j'ai besoin d'un maillot de bain.
I want to go to the beach, but I need a swimsuit.

preposition : *for*

On va au parc pour jouer.
We go to the park to play.

personal pronoun : *himself, herself, themselves (see #60)*

Il se laisse suivre par le chien.
He lets himself be followed by the dog.

indefinite article : *some (used before a plural noun) (see #14, 26)*

Il y a des livres sur la table.
There are some books on the table.

verb, noun : *to say, tell*

Je vais te donner un conseil là : il faut dire la vérité.
I am going to give you some advice here: you must tell the truth.

verb, noun : *can, to be able to*

Ce pouvoir influence ces décisions.
This power influences these decisions.

verb : *to want*

Il veut se reposer chez sa tante.
He wants to rest at his aunt's house.

conjunction : *but*

Il se croit intelligent, mais il fait souvent des erreurs.
He thinks he is smart, but he often makes mistakes.

personal pronoun : *me, myself*

Il veut me montrer une autre chose.
He wants to show me another thing.

personal pronoun : *we, us*

Nous allons bien avec nos amis.
We are doing well with our friends.

preposition : *in, into*

Le chat se cache dans la boîte.  
The cat hides in the box.

personal pronoun : *she, it (refers to a feminine singular noun)*

Elle mange une pomme du jardin.
She eats an apple from the garden.

verb : *to know; languagedaily dot com*

Je pense que tu sais quoi faire ici.
I think you know what to do here.

definite article : *(de + le/les) = of the, from the*

Il y a du pain sur la table.
There is some bread on the table.

relative pronoun, interrogative pronoun : *where, that*

Où ne vous trouvez-vous pas?
Where do you not find yourself?

personal pronoun : *it, there*

Il y a des livres que j'aime lire.
There are some books that I like to read.

personal pronoun : *you, yourself (shortened form used before a vowel)*

Je t'aime parce que la vie est belle.
I love you because life is beautiful.

adverb, noun : *well, very; good*

French: Je t'aime bien pour sa gentillesse.
English: I like you for his/her kindness.

verb : *to see*

Je ne vois pas des oiseaux.
I do not see any birds.

adverb : *more*

French: Ce gâteau est plus bon pour toi.
English: This cake is better for you.

adverb : *no*

Non, je ne parle pas à lui.  
No, I do not speak to him.

personal pronoun : *you, yourself*

Je te dois dire où aller.
I have to tell you where to go.

possessive adjective : *my (used before a masculine singular noun) (see #27, 108)*

Mon frère joue avec toi.  
My brother plays with you.

definite article : *at the, to the, in the (contraction of à + le; used with a singular masculine noun)*

Nous n'allons pas au parc.
We are not going to the park.

preposition : *with*

Je joue aussi avec mon ami comme toi.  
I also play with my friend like you.

personal pronoun : *I, me*

Ils parlent de moi.
They talk about me.

adverb, conjunction : *yes; if; so, such*

Si tu attends ici, qui va nous aider ?
If you wait here, who will help us?

adjective, relative pronoun, interrogative pronoun : *what (exclamatory, interrogative, after preposition)*

Quoi avoir l'importance dans cette situation?
What has importance in this situation?

verb, noun : *to have to, must; duty, test*

Je dois faire mes devoirs, mais je ne sais pas quand ni quoi étudier.
I have to do my homework, but I don't know when or what to study.

adverb : *yes*

Oui, c'est aussi une chose importante.
Yes, it is also an important thing.

personal pronoun : *they (refers to a group of masculine or mixed masculine/feminine nouns)*

Ils voient la maison là-bas.
They see the house over there.

conjunction, adverb : *as, like; how, same*

Comme si je pouvais vivre avec toi.  
As if I could live with you.

personal pronoun, conjunction : *himself, herself, themselves (variation of "se" used before a word starting with a vowel or mute h)*

Elle s' arrête pour penser à cette idée.
She stops to think about this idea.

verb : *to come, occur*

Je ne peux pas venir avec toi.  
I cannot come with you.

preposition, adjective : *on, upon; over (preposition); sour (adjective)*

Je ne suis jamais bien sur de la réponse.
I am never quite sure of the answer.

personal pronoun : *you*

La maison est très belle, toi aussi.
The house is very beautiful, you too.

adverb : *here*

Je veux des pommes ici.  
I want some apples here.

indefinite pronoun : *nothing*

Je n'ai rien pour quand tu arrives.
I have nothing for when you arrive.

personal pronoun : *he, him, it, her*

Tu lui as donné le livre que je t'ai prêté.
You gave him the book that I lent you.

adjective, onomatopoeia, noun, adverb : *good, right, kind; good!; voucher; then; french.languagedaily.com*

French: Là, le bon devoir fait un bon bruit bon.
English: There, the good homework makes a good sound well.

adverb : *there, here, then*

Elle est là et te regarde.  
She is there and watching you.

verb : *to follow*

Elle veut suivre le cours, mais elle est en retard.
She wants to follow the class, but she is late.

adverb, conjunction : *why*

Pourquoi a-t-il laissé son sac ici ?
Why did he leave his bag here?

verb : *to speak, talk*

Je veux parler pour quoi faire.
I want to speak for what purpose.

verb : *to take, get*

Je ne peux pas venir prendre le bus.
I cannot come to take the bus.

demonstrative adjective : *this, that (feminine singular)*

Cette maison est si belle à voir.
This house is so beautiful to see.

conjunction : *when, whenever*

Quand je dois parler, je suis nerveux.
When I have to speak, I am nervous.

adverb : *then; so; hence*

Alors, je veux savoir pourquoi tu es là.  
So, I want to know why you are there.

noun : *thing, matter*

Je veux suivre une chose importante.
I want to follow an important thing.

preposition : *per, by, through, out of*

Il s'arrête par la maison qui est rouge.
He stops by the house that is red.

possessive adjective : *his, her, its (possessive adjective); sound (noun - le son)*

Son frère a pris le livre d'école de sa sœur.
His brother took his sister's school book.

verb : *to believe, think*

Je crois du fond de mon cœur que tu me comprends.
I believe from the bottom of my heart that you understand me.

verb : *to love, like, be fond of*

J'aime de croire en toi.
I like to believe in you.

verb : *it is necessary, must, have to*

Il faut donner de l'amour.
It is necessary to give love.

adverb, conjunction, onomatopoeia : *how; what*

Comment de bon gâteau!
How good the cake is!

adverb : *very*

Nous sommes très contents de l'autre côté.
We are very happy on the other side.

conjunction : *or; either… or*

Elle ne sait pas quoi choisir, un livre ou un film.
She doesn't know what to choose, a book or a movie.

verb : *to pass, go by, cross*

Je vais passer dans le parc.  
I am going to pass through the park.

verb : *to think*

Je pense plus à ta santé.
I think more about your health.

adverb : *also, too*

Elle croit aussi en ses rêves.
She also believes in her dreams.

adverb : *never*

Je ne mange jamais du pain qui est dur.
I never eat bread that is hard.

verb : *to wait for, expect*

Je vais attendre cette fille une minute.
I will wait for this girl one minute.

verb : *to find*

Il s'est perdu ici et il ne peut pas se trouver.
He got lost here and he can't find himself.

verb : *to leave*

Il faut laisser un message.
It is necessary to leave a message.

adjective, noun : *small, little, young (adjective); languagedaily dot com; kid, child (masculine noun)*

Je vais du petit déjeuner.
I am going to the small breakfast.

onomatopoeia, noun : *thanks, thank you*

Sa voix douce a dit "merci" et t'a fait sourire.  
Her soft voice said "thank you" and made you smile.

adverb, adjective : *same; even, so much as, as*

Même si tu me vois, je ne te vois pas.
Even if you see me, I don't see you.

possessive adjective : *his, her, its (feminine)*

Sa mère peut venir ici.
Her mother can come here.

possessive adjective : *your (reminine)*

Ta maison est plus grande que les miennes.
Your house is bigger than mine.

adjective, indefinite pronoun : *other, another, different (singular)*

Il faut donner l'autre livre.
It is necessary to give the other book.

verb : *to arrive*

Ça va arriver bientôt.
It will arrive soon.

demonstrative adjective : *these, those (plural form of masculine "ce" and feminine "cette")*

Ces livres sont si intéressants, tu devrais les lire.
These books are so interesting, you should read them.

verb : *to give, give away*

Je veux donner ce petit cadeau, mais je ne sais pas comment.
I want to give this small gift, but I don't know how.
